descript.abstract: Regional street network with geocodable addresses. Each street segment has all address components for address matching. Streets are categorized by type for cartographic purposes. A separate annotation layer is available. These streets and address range information is used by 911 centers for dispatch information. Since the accuracy of this information is important for emergency dispatch, they provide updates on a regular basis. Virtually every street in the region is in this data layer.
descript.purpose: For locating street addresses and for cartographic products requiring a street base map.

idinfo.useconst: For product terms and conditions, please see http://www.oregonmetro.gov/index.cfm/go/by.web/id=505

horizpa.horizpar: The street linework is contained within the street rights-of-way as shown on the tax lot layer. As the tax lot horizonal accuracy is improved, streets are adjusted accordingly.

procstep.procdesc: Acquired street linework and annotation from Oregon Department of Transportation. This was digitized from 7 1/2 minutes USGS quad sheets.

Replaced linework with newly digitized line work which "fell within" the street rights-of-way from the tax lot layer. Attributes were transfered from the U.S. Census Bureau TIGER file. Street names and address ranges were updated using paper maps collected from the three counties. Thomas Brothers Mapping was the primary contractor.
We deleted types 1600, 1900, 2100, 2200, 3100, 3210, 3220. Streets are no longer shown on the Clark County side of the river. Contact Clark County for detailed street information.
This layer was reprojected to the NAD83/91 projection (also known as HPGN) as part of a conversion of all RLIS map layers.
Projection information (.prj file), compatible with ArcGIS 8.1, was added to the layer.
Add XML metadata compatible with ArcCatalog 8.1
QC street name, addresses, city and zipcodes using E-911 CAD materials for Clackamas County (complete 20020901) and Washington County (complete 20021031).

Hillsboro streets positional accuracy was improved. Streets were snapped to local planimetric data with a +/- 1' tolerance. The City of Hillsboro now maintains their subarea and supplies the data to Metro on a weekly basis.
Fname item (Streetname field/column in shapefile and SDE versions) expanded from 30 to 50 characters in width to accommodate the 50 character width used in the City of Portland's centerline file.
Hillsboro no longer maintains the street segments within the City of Hillsboro; their maintenance has been taken back by Metro.
Streets are now maintained as a master SDE feature class and the shapefile and SDE feature class STREETS.Streets are derived from this. The coverage has been retired.

Unnamed street segments in the City of Portland maintenance area now have their fdpre/prefix, fname/streetname and ftype values all calculated to a blank value to match how unnamed streets are handled throughout the rest of the region.

In preparation for transferring maintenance of all Washington Co street segments to Washington Co., those segments previously maintained by the City of Hillsboro and indicated in the master regional file with a subarea value of "H" have had their subarea value changed to "W".
At the request of Clackmas County additional Forest Service roads (type 9000) are now included.
Streets in Washington County are now maintained by Washington County.
Washington County now uses the 9000 (Forest Service road) type.

distinfo.distliab: The information in this file was derived from digital databases on Metro's GIS. Care was taken in the creation of this file. Metro cannot accept any responsibility for errors, omissions, or positional accuracy. There are no warranties, expressed or implied.

digtinfo.formname: Shapefile or ESRI geodatabase format. Hourly fee will be charged for conversion

onlinopt.accinstr: Most RLIS layers are available on the RLIS Discovery site. Email drc@oregonmetro.gov or call 503 797-1742 for further instructions.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
